facts.text: Rajasthan Sales Tax Rules published in Rajasthan Gazette on March 28, 1955.
Rajasthan Sales Tax Act came into force on April 1, 1955.
Respondent filed Civil Writ Petition No. 11 of 1958 challenging assessments for 1955-56 on ground Rules invalid.
High Court passed interim order on January 9, 1958: petitioner to keep proper accounts, file prescribed returns, but not to be assessed till further orders.
Ordinance No. 5 of 1959 promulgated on November 6, 1959, validating the Rules; respondent withdrew Writ Petition No. 11 of 1958.
Rajasthan Sales Tax Validation Act (Rajasthan Act 43 of 1959) replaced Ordinance on December 17, 1959, validating Rules.
Sales Tax Officer sent show cause notice on December 4, 1959: writ dismissed on 23rd November 1959, deposit tax due within a week or action taken.
Respondent filed return for 4th quarter ending October 22, 1957, and deposited Rs. 11,898.31 as tax.
Respondent deposited Rs. 28,607 as tax on January 8, 1960, March 5, 1960, and March 19, 1960 for four quarters October 23, 1957 to November 10, 1958. Not clear if returns filed on these dates.

Sales Tax Officer assessed period November 3, 1956 to October 22, 1957 on April 25, 1960, imposed penalty of Rs. 400 under s.16(1)(b) for not depositing tax on due date, citing stay order did not allow withholding tax.
Respondent appealed to Deputy Commissioner Sales Tax (Appeals), Kotah, who dismissed appeal holding stay order did not justify not filing return and depositing tax per s.7(2).
Sales Tax Officer assessed period October 23, 1957 to November 10, 1958 on December 6, 1960, imposed penalty of Rs. 1,000 for not depositing tax in time on same grounds.

Respondent filed Writ Petition No. 111 of 1961 on April 3, 1961 challenging penalty for November 3, 1956 to October 22, 1957; No. 172 of 1961 on April 4, 1961 for October 23, 1957 to November 10, 1958.
Rajasthan High Court on February 5, 1963 allowed writ petitions, quashed penalties holding violation of Art. 20(1) Constitution.
Supreme Court appeals by special leave against High Court judgment.

legal_issues.text: Whether penalties under s.16(1)(b) of Rajasthan Sales Tax Act validly imposed for failure to pay tax due within time allowed, given no returns filed earlier due to High Court stay order and deposits made with returns later.
Whether tax is 'due' under s.16(1)(b) before assessment under s.10 or filing of return with deposit under s.7(2).

petitioner_arguments.text: Tax becomes due because of charging sections s.3 with s.5; show cause notice on Dec 4, 1959 required deposit, delay in compliance breaches s.16(1)(b).
High Court stay order required submission of returns per law including s.7(2) deposit; failure to do so earlier breaches s.16(1)(b).
High Court erred in holding violation of Art.20(1); original Rules valid from April 1, 1955.

respondent_arguments.text: No breach of s.16(1)(b); no tax due till returns filed under s.7(1); s.7(2) complied with when returns filed Dec 18, 1959 and Jan-Mar 1960 with deposits.
No tax due till assessment under s.10.

court_reasoning.text: No breach of s.16(1)(b); requires tax due and failure to pay within time allowed; no tax due till ascertained by assessment under s.10 or by assessee under s.7(2); only liability to tax exists before.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Charging ss.3,5 create liability to pay tax, but tax not 'due' under s.16(1)(b) till quantified.

court_reasoning.text: Show cause notice Dec 4, 1959 does not make tax due; no rule or Act provision authorizes it to create due date.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Notice possibly had r.31 in mind, but that applies post-assessment.

court_reasoning.text: Stay order does not imply obligation to deposit tax, else no utility to assessee; s.7(2) not attracted till returns filed.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Respondent complied when returns and deposits made.

court_reasoning.text: No need to decide Art.20(1) or Rules validity; dispose on statutory construction.

holdings.text: No tax due within s.16(1)(b) till assessed under s.10 or deposited per return under s.7(2); no breach, penalties invalid.
Charging sections create liability, not 'due' tax for penalty purposes pre-quantification.

outcome.summary: Appeals dismissed; penalties quashed as no breach of s.16(1)(b) since no tax due till returns filed with deposits.
outcome.relief_granted: Penalties imposed by Sales Tax Officer quashed.
